intro: Peixotoa hispidula, commonly known as the hairy peixotoa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Peixotoa hispidula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks.
